setVerticalFitting

public void setVerticalFitting(boolean auto,
                               float min,
                               float max)
Set the state of the vertical fitting. If vertical fitting is enabled then the vertical scale is made depending on the maximal and minimal values in the graphs. If min and max is given then the scale is made using them.

Parameters:
auto - Enable automatic scale fitting
min - The minimal value of the scale
max - The maximal value of the scale

removeGraph

public void removeGraph(int graph)
Removes a graph from the cache so it will not be rendered when plotData is called

Parameters:
graph - The index of the graph to be removed

Parameters:

setForcedPlotting

public void setForcedPlotting(boolean enabled)
Force plotting the the data even if it is the same time range. Forced plotting is always turned off after a forced plot so you will have to turn on forced plotting again before the next plot.

Parameters:
enabled - The plotting is forced

setGridColor

public void setGridColor(String color)
Sets the scale grid color, set to null to not draw the grid

Parameters:
color - The color

setVerticalAxisNumberFormat

public void setVerticalAxisNumberFormat(com.google.gwt.i18n.client.NumberFormat verticalAxisNumberFormat)
Set the format to format the vertical axis value to a string. See http://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/i18n/format/decimalFormat.html form more information about the different formats that can be used.

Parameters:
verticalAxisNumberFormat - The format of the number to display
